column4: Any chance someone can answer a question about Ubuntu installation problems?
So I burned Ubuntu 10.04 to a CD and booted it.  It gets to the point where it asks what time zone I'm in.  I click 'forward', and it simply doesn't respond or do anything

I re-burned the CD, and the same thing happened.  I can use that CD to test Ubuntu... it actually runs from that... however when installing it just doesn't do anything after trying to leave the time zone selection screen.
Currently downloading 11.04 to see if it does anything different.  Otherwise, any ideas?
Thanks doctorZeus.  How do I check the md5hash?  I know what it is... I've just never looked into how to verify one
No, never entered my mind until it was mentioned above.
Bah... looks like google pointed me how to check it in Linux terminal
Unfortunately I'm in Windows (dual-boot system).
there are softwares to do it on windows
google something like md5 file check windows
Cool, thanks.  Currently looking into getting a checker and see what it spits out.
Gah, right, Windows doesn't recognize 'ls' in command prompt :P
Yeah, I think I direct downloaded it from ubuntu's site.  Which is where 11.04 is coming from.  Eh, might as well check that when it's done too.
Well crap.  Looks like the md5 matches.
did you try another time zone to see if it works?
That is a good thing normally, except I was hoping that the file being bad was the problem :P
Didn't try another time zone yet, since it just auto-selects the right one.  Suppose I could try that.
oopies
Will wait until 11.04 finishes downloading though
I accidentally my IRC client.

Don't see how a different time zone would change much, but who knows.  It's like when I click 'forward', I get the hourglass, the CD spins down, and then the computer just sits there like a rock.  I can move the mouse and whatnot, and even click 'x' to exit.  It acknowledges that.
Strange, strange problem
sometimes strange problems have strange solutions
